question: What is Manolis Kalomiris famous for?
option1: As the founder of the Italian National School of Music
option2: As the founder of the Greek National School of Music
option3: As the founder of the Russian National School of Music
option4: As the founder of the German National School of Music
answer: As the founder of the Greek National School of Music
explanation: Manolis Kalomiris was a Greek classical composer. He was the founder of the Greek National School of Music. A passionate composer, he has a post-romantic idiom characterised by rich harmonies and orchestrations, complex counterpoints, long eastern melodies, and the frequent use of Greek folk rhythms. A preoccupation with love and death transcends all five of his music dramas.
